result.execSummary:
The defendant Kier L Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Court will allow early termination if Agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a condition of probation.

Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms/ammunition.
Forfeiture of gun and ammunition.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety as it pertains to controlled substances only.  Random Samples.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Not to use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - To commence Monday 12/07/2015 at 12:00 p.m.

records.addlTxt: received March 21, 2016 from Kimberly Windom, requesting funeral leave for Kier Pearson.  No action taken by the court, reviewed on 3/22/2016 by Judge Ramirez.
Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Andrew Ladd
Character and Counseling.

Defendant Kier L Pearson in court with attorney Andrew Charles Ladd.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Ladd makes statements.  Defendants father makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days)
2 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years
Court will allow early termination if agent deems appropriate
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety as it pertains to controlled substances only; Random Samples.  
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms/ammunition.
Not to use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctors prescription
Forfeiture of gun and ammunition
Condition Time: 6 months Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence Monday 12/7/2015 @ Noon
FINE 908.00 Bail to be applied, remainder of the bail to be returned to the poster. 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 12-02-2015 03:15 pm
dated Sep 30, 2015,   Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel

Defendant Kier L Pearson in court with attorney Andrew Charles Ladd.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count #1 with the repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  Court schedules this case for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keir L Pearson in court.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting that the court appoint counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Keir L Pearson in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant needs more time to obtain bail.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Case recalled at 11:15 with attorney Tom Harris appearing as a friend of the court.  Court changes date for hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Refunded 90 days after posting.

Bond has already been posted.   Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms or ambition for the firearms.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
